instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers on, Fan Spins High, No other life.
threads.message:
Working on the first non-liquid <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> unit I've seen yet. This one powers on (no charger noise), no chime (normal), no video/backlight, and fan ramps up to full speed gradually. Inspected board completed, no liquid anywhere. Tried a new BIOS to be sure, and same behavior.

I'll start going over the lower rails tomorrow, but wanted to get this posted in case there are any common things to check on this model. All help and direction appreciated--thanks as always!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, Powers on, Fan Spins High, No other life.
